response.original_title: Why We Use Money, or the Fisherman Who Needed a Knife
response.overview: The film tells the story of a fisherman who, in a time before money existed, attempts to trade his catch for various items he needs, such as a knife and a hat. He faces challenges as each tradesman he encounters requires different goods in exchange. Eventually, they come up with the idea of using precious metals as a common medium of exchange, leading to the creation of coins. This new system simplifies trading, allowing the fisherman to sell his fish for money and easily purchase what he needs.
response.title: Why We Use Money, or the Fisherman Who Needed a Knife
